topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body: Also not-so-fun fact: the Poison Arrow frog of South America is the most poisonous animal on Earth. It's poison is so deadly that just touching it with the tip of your finger can be fatal. In fact just the residue from the frog can kill you meaning that if the frog was sitting on a rock and you stepped on the rock barefoot or picked it up with your bare hands, just the trace amount of poison the frog left behind could kill you in less than a minute.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5334f0de63687232ff720000#post_5334f0de63687232ff720000
I've been to Afghanistan and Iraq. All three of those diseases were a problem we had to be aware of.

Fun fact: Malaria pills will give you weird fucking dreams the first few weeks you take them, and you've got to continue taking them for a couple months after you get out of a country where you needed them, at least if I remember correctly.

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5334f32f6368723560440100#post_5334f32f6368723560440100
I'm an outdoorsman, I don't mind any kind of animals at all not even spiders, the only things I do mind are microscopic parasites and viruses. Basically unless the animal is very hungry or feels threatened it will leave you alone. Unless we are taking about hippos or Canadian geese, they will attack anything.


"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5334f24a6368720b081e0000#post_5334f24a6368720b081e0000
Yep chloroquine is nasty stuff. Another fun fact: the popular drink gin-and-tonic came from using gin mixed with quinine (the natural form of chloroquine) because the gin would offset the very bitter taste.
